intro: Anemone narcissiflora var. pedicellaris, commonly known as the pedicellaris anemone, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It features showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a yellow center. The plant typically grows to a height of 12 to 24 inches and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, making it a suitable choice for woodland gardens. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, adding ornamental value to shaded landscapes.
